title: EIM12850 - Termination payments and benefits:the most common payments and benefits taxable in full

details.body:
The most common termination payments and benefits within [EIM12810](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12810.htm) which are taxable in full under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 are shown below.
### Type of payment ### Notes ### Guidance
A payment received under the terms and conditions of service. Such terms may be in the main contract document or elsewhere, for example in a staff handbook or letter of appointment. See example [EIM13920](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13920.htm).Most such payments are taxable under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 but exceptions are redundancy payments (see [EIM13750](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13750.htm)) and lump sums from pension schemes approved by IR SPSS (Nottingham).[EIM00610](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00610.htm) [EIM13920](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13920.htm)
A non-contractual payment that the employer is accustomed to make and/or that the employee could reasonably have expected to receive. [EIM00640](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00640.htm) [EIM12977](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12977.htm)
A payment made to induce an employee take up an employment.The payment is earnings (see [EIM00515](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00515.htm)) from the new employment.[EIM00700](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00700.htm)
See [EIM12950](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12950.htm) for information concerning payments made under the Employment Rights Act 1996
